intro: Psychotria pectinata, commonly known as the "velvetleaf psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria pectinata is also noted for its chemical complexity, containing various alkaloids that have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
